verses.roman:
agra-nyasta-viṣāṇāgraḥ
stabdhāsṛg-locano 'cyutam
kaṭākṣipyādravat tūrṇam
indra-mukto 'śanir yathā

synonyms: agra—forward; nyasta—pointing; viṣāṇa—of his horns; agraḥ—the front; stabdha—glaring; asṛk—bloody; locanaḥ—his eyes; acyutam—at Lord Kṛṣṇa; kaṭa-ākṣipya—looking sideways; adravat—he ran; tūrṇam—at full speed; indra-muktaḥ—released by King Indra; aśaniḥ—a thunderbolt; yathā—like.
translation: Pointing the tips of his horns straight ahead and glaring menacingly at Lord Kṛṣṇa from the corners of his bloodshot eyes, Ariṣṭa rushed toward Him at full speed, like a thunderbolt hurled by Indra.
